description:
Error handling is done at multiple levels. At the API level, we use Axios interceptors to handle common errors like authentication failures. At the component level, we use try/catch blocks to manage UI-specific errors. And, we use Vue's global error handler to catch unexpected runtime errors and log them to monitoring tools such as Sentry. We also manage error and loading states through Pinia or Vuex.

Global Application Error Handling: We define it in main.js when creating the Vue app instance using app.config.errorHandler, before mounting the application.

Companies install the Sentry Vue SDK and initialize it in main.js while creating the Vue app instance.
AbortController allows canceling pending API requests to prevent unnecessary network calls and memory leaks, especially useful when components unmount or navigation changes.
